home.title: Welcome to Atomic Systems
home.subtitle: Build better habits through systems, not goals

dashboard.ready_message: Ready to work on your atomic systems today?
dashboard.new_identity_area_desc: Define a new life area to focus on
dashboard.new_atomic_system_desc: Create a system to build habits
dashboard.no_systems_message: You haven't created any systems yet. Let's start by defining your identity areas and building your first atomic system.
dashboard.upgrade_message: Unlock unlimited systems, advanced analytics, and full history tracking.

identity_areas.title: Identity Areas
identity_areas.subtitle: Define the areas of life where you want to build atomic systems
identity_areas.description: Identity areas represent different aspects of your life where you want to focus on growth. Each area helps you think in terms of identity: "I am someone who..." rather than "I want to do..."
identity_areas.no_areas_message: You haven't created any identity areas yet. Start by defining the first area of your life where you want to build better systems.
identity_areas.name: Area Name
identity_areas.description_placeholder: What does this area represent in your life?
identity_areas.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this identity area? This action cannot be undone.

atomic_systems.title: Atomic Systems
atomic_systems.subtitle: Create systems that make good habits inevitable and bad habits impossible
atomic_systems.description: Atomic systems are based on James Clear's 4 Laws of Behavior Change. Each system is designed to be Obvious, Attractive, Easy, and Satisfying.
atomic_systems.no_systems_message: You haven't created any atomic systems yet. Start by creating your first system to build better habits.
atomic_systems.system_description_placeholder: Describe what this system helps you achieve...
atomic_systems.law_1_placeholder: How will you make this habit obvious? (Cues, triggers, environment)
atomic_systems.law_2_placeholder: How will you make this habit attractive? (Rewards, motivation)
atomic_systems.law_3_placeholder: How will you make this habit easy? (Reduce friction, 2-minute rule)
atomic_systems.law_4_placeholder: How will you make this habit satisfying? (Instant rewards, tracking)

onboarding.subtitle: Let's get you started building better habits through systems, not goals
onboarding.step_1_content: Instead of setting goals like "I want to lose weight", think in terms of identity: "I am someone who exercises daily". This small shift makes habits stick.
onboarding.step_2_content: Define 2-3 areas of your life where you want to grow. These could be Health, Learning, Relationships, or Creativity.
onboarding.step_3_content: For each identity area, create systems using the 4 Laws: Make it Obvious, Attractive, Easy, and Satisfying.

identity_goals.title: Directional Goals
identity_goals.no_goals_description: Goals provide direction to your systems
